title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 January 2016 - XWiki
content:

09:49 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <ol-ow2> Hi, i've two wikis: from HTTPS: WikiA:space.pageA i use {{include document="WikiB:space.pageB"}}, this HTTP: space.pageB doc is visible for all (guest/allgroup), same for pageA. But a logged in user cannot view this pageA. Why ? any idea ?  
10:03 <ol-ow2> ho, and this the same farm  
10:04 <tmortagne> ol-ow2: depends what you means by allgroup  
10:04 <tmortagne> each wiki has it's own allgroup group  
10:04 <ol-ow2> local allgroup  
10:04 <ol-ow2> from each  
10:05 <ol-ow2> the user from wikiA is logged in, but doesn't exist in wikiB  
10:05 <tmortagne> I think right system does not support right assigned to groups from other wiki, Denis ?  
10:05 <tmortagne> (except or main wiki)  
10:05 <tmortagne> s/or/for/  
10:06 <ol-ow2> but should be considered as guest no ?  
10:06 <tmortagne> not right now no, guest is not considered fallback right unfortunately  
10:06 <mflorea> has quit  
10:06 <tmortagne> let me find you the jira issue  
10:06 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7434  
10:08 <ol-ow2> So, this user shoud be logged in with an farm account ?  
10:09 <tmortagne> global (main wiki) groups/users can be assigned rights in any wiki yes  
10:09 <ol-ow2> ok, thx  
10:10 <Denis> yep, I confirm, local user are isolated in their wiki, only global user could have rights on multiple wikis  
10:14 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, the extension at http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Authenticator+Headers doesn't seem to install correctly from the extensions manager :  I got : "java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.xwiki.authentication.headers.XWikiHeadersAuthenticator". I remember having this issue back in Jan 2015 when we first tried it and Oana advised to install the jar by hand. Do you know why ?  
10:15 <martinus\_\_> we're running xwiki 6.4.4  
10:16 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: you probably installed it in a wiki, I think authenticators are only supported from root ("install on farm")  
10:16 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, oh well, thanks  
10:17 <martinus\_\_> I also have this : "... WARN  .a.i.c.PlexusContainerProvider - Could not validate integrity of download from http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-core/4.4.1/xwiki-platform-core-4.4.1.pom: Checksum validation failed, expected xxxx (...)"  
10:17 <martinus\_\_> but i'll try from root  
10:18 <tmortagne> this warn is something different, looks like the md5 at http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-core/4.4.1/ is wrong so it cannot validate the pom  
10:18 <tmortagne> or you are being attached but I doubt that :)  
10:19 <martinus\_\_> what do you mean with "being attached" ? :)  
10:20 <tmortagne> \*attacked sorry  
10:26 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <vmassol> guys, just sent a new mail on the list regarding best practices for scripting apis. If you don't have the time to read the thread (yes I spammed a bit with my experimentations ;)) then you can just read this last mail (although previous mesages on the thread provide details) :)  
11:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I've commented, thanks  
11:30 <vmassol> we need to decide if it's ok to break backward compat for uberspectors or if instead we wish to revert sergiu's change and just move them to legacy  
11:30 <vmassol> wdyt?  
11:32 <sdumitriu> Going to bed  
11:32 <vmassol> ok, have a good night, we can talk about what to do tomorrow for you  
11:32 <vmassol> thanks for tackling this

17:42 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: note: you forgot to update previous version and clirr setup after 7.4 release in 7.4.x branch  
17:42 <tmortagne> (taking care of it)  
17:42 <gdelhumeau> indeed  
17:42 <gdelhumeau> thanks you  
17:43 <tmortagne> looks like release script left rendering/platform/xe parent with 7.4 instead of 7.4.1-SNAPSHOT, that's what cause the failing platform build  
18:01 <RodrigoPT76> hello everyone  
18:02 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:04 <RodrigoPT76> One question.. I'm considering making changes to the tagging interface. Use an approach like a jquery tagging plugin (add/display tags on an input field, instead of the form that is used now. What would be the best approach to achieve this?  
18:05 <RodrigoPT76> I could just change documentTags.vm and tags.js directly  
18:05 <RodrigoPT76> (i think)  
18:05 <RodrigoPT76> but would like to try this the right way  
18:17 <ClemensR> seems you want to write a "custom skin" like http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Skins  
18:18 <ClemensR> you can override templates by defining new fields on the "skin document" you are using; e.g. by using the http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Skin+Application  
18:23 <ClemensR> if you prefer not to change things in the browser, use the info in the first link, i.e. create a new directory in the webapps "skins" directory, and put into it  a skin.properties  with a line like  parent=flamingo ... then place custom variants of documentTags.vm and tags.js  into that directory  
18:41 <RodrigoPT76> thanks Clemens, I will do that override in the filesystem, as I do find it easier to edit on the shell. Thanks for the tips.  
18:46 <ClemensR> while developing you maybe want to add two lines to WEB-INF/xwiki.properties :  "velocity.properties = file.resource.loader.cache=false"  and " velocity.properties = velocimacro.library.autoreload=true "  as otherwise the \*.vm are cached and changes need a server restart to be visible  
18:46 <ol-ow2> has quit
